wikipedia_page.main:
Herbert Chipp (4 January 1850 – 25 August 1903) was an English tennis player.
Chipp participated in the Wimbledon Championships in between 1882 and 1900. In 1884 he reached the semifinals of the all-comers competition, which he lost to Herbert Lawford 5–7, 4–6, 4–6.In 1898 he published the book Lawn Tennis Recollections, and he contributed parts to  J. M. Heathcotes book Tennis; Lawn Tennis, Rackets; Fives. He also was Honorary Secretary of the Lawn Tennis Association.Chipp died in 1903 at the age of 53.
